column4: hey guys, quick question, is the ubuntu install easy for a person new to linux?
yes, but you should know what you're doing before getting into it
the most confuzing part, imo, is knowing how to set up partitions
it use a graphical client for that or fdisk command line?
graphical, though i'd highly suggest using windows-based partition software if he's resizing an ntfs partition with vista on it
aye you have a reccomendation for whta type of software to resize his ntfs with(xp windows)
i say ext3 first because that's the one he should use
well, eh, use a dos-based partition program
partition magic works well in xp, i'm not sure if they have a vista-compatible version yet

but if he's resizing an ntfs partition with vista on it in gparted (graphical partition software on the ubuntu live cd), it will corrupt the partition and he'll have to re-install vista, and then re-install grub
otherwise, very easy install, as easy as xp
